title: Wrongfully suspended and punished for Elo Boosting

embed.description: Red Bird Jg / Silver 1 13LP / 447W 466L Win Ratio 49% / Katarina - 75W 64L Win Ratio 54%, Gangplank - 19W 31L Win Ratio 38%, Jhin - 21W 28L Win Ratio 43%, Riven - 15W 26L Win Ratio 37%, Syndra - 24W 16L Win Ratio 60%

body:
TLDR; I was wrongfully suspended for being Eloboosted, just look at my op.gg and you'd know. I ended season silver 3 and am silver 1 now. Lol.

Alright, so today when I went to login I was greeted by a nice message:

https://gyazo.com/e6c6a2d47d6f94b0b97e39b4910815ac

I thought, oh god, had I become toxic once more ? No, this was not the case, I logged into my dedicated email that has all my LoL accounts attached to it and saw an email I recieved which read this:

https://gyazo.com/8b59c947fdcd45852610b80df8f3ce3a
https://gyazo.com/9d2c079eda3e0959fe16a03892728b5a

Hmm, strange, I had been caught getting elo boosted ? This made absolutely no sense, as I would never pay someone to Elo boost me in the first place. Now before you jump to conclusions and say, you're clearly lying, heres some facts for you:

I played 916 ranked games this season (Roughly)
I peaked silver 1 promos to gold several times, unfortunately losing them everytime.
I hovered between silver 2 and silver 1 for the majority of the season.
I ended the season silver 3, and just now in the preseason have I hit silver 1 again.

So I figured I'd send in a support ticket to Riots fabled Player Support, I wrote to them, "So I just saw I got an Elo boosting email. I'm not quite sure why you guys think i've been elo boosting, I have proof its only been me playing on the account. My friend has streamed every game on (Friends twitch link), and i've only played with him since playing League again. I have no idea why you guys think i've been eloboosted...."

And they responded with this:

https://gyazo.com/ffb8ce9654ad7f5b4b4b61e65399837e

I left the supporters name out for privacy reasons. Now, this seemed odd to me, "Your suspension was only issued after an extensive investigation", so you extensively investigated my account and saw that I am an average player, who ended the season in the average league, and is still, in the pre season, in the average league. Interesting.

Now, I'm not posting this here to cause drama, I am posting this because I hope they see that they made a mistake and correct that mistake. I would very much like to keep my season rewards and continue play on my account.

EDIT: They responded to my newest ticket with this: 

https://gyazo.com/a990fd4c321af6cc5c8897cc894e9ca3

So I guess they will not give me the chance to provide my evidence, nor would it matter is what this agent said. Its so easy to see that I was not in any sense or way boosted. I bet they looked at the ranked games I played before I moved away for school, and then when I moved away. And saw a different IP and then eventually a different MAC. I started to use a laptop instead of my PC. But I still have both, I can willingly provide all MAC's used on the account as well as ALL IP addresses. But I guess it doesn't matter, because like a toddler, when Player support thinks something, they won't change their mind.

I hold nothing against Riot as a company, I've put several thousand dollars into the game as well as thousands of hours I will never get back. I have played this game since season 2 with out ever getting even a warning for something like MMR Boosting, I am disappointed that I was not given a fair opportunity to prove my innocence but so be it. Unfortunately I see now that I am not valued as a customer to them, nor a player. Thus I will not be returning to the game and will be quitting; I do not wish to play a game made by a company who deems it okay to punish someone for something they did not do, and then not even give them the chance to prove it. It is unlawful and childish, but so be it. So I guess this is goodbye, after 7 years of playing such a wonderful game, it gets ruined by something like this.

Edit: Keyru has responded on my ticket, and I have just provided my proof. Hopefully it will be enough for him to reconsider and see I am in-fact innocent. I am posting this to stay honest, and will not deface Riot's image even if I am not happy with them. Trying to give the full story:

https://gyazo.com/afd93073ac66ab97045a52dd77e6bde8

Final update: Keyru said my proof is not enough to show I wasn't MMR boosted. I guess every MAC and IP that's played on the account is not enough. I have nothing left I can provide. I cannot upload 2TB of videos for them. I guess  I'm just going to be wrongfully punished. Sorry to say I will no longer be playing this game. 

https://gyazo.com/e335e12ea05685032784c3e897e4e3ed

replies.body:
Hey all,

Chiming in to say that our support team handling these types tickets are not robots and each player that is writing in regarding their MMR bans does have a human eye looking at them. I know it kind of sucks that we aren't sharing more information but this is done so that for those who are in the 100% (which we are confident in) can't retrace their steps and "fix" what they did that got them caught in the first place.

MMR Boosting doesn't have to be a paid service. It can be a simple act of sharing an account with someone and them playing ranked on it. They don't have to reach a particular tier (Gold+) and it doesn't look into how you played the majority of the season. Once someone that is not you, logs into your account and plays a ranked game, this is considered MMR Boosting. This is why we strongly tell players they should not share their account information and credentials, even to those they trust.

As to OP, I've read your case. Multiple agents and myself included, have looked into your account and we're all confident this was an accurate punishment which won't be reversed. We can continue the discussion in the support ticket that you submitted.

I'm going to preface this by saying, if you guys have done the legwork I specifically mention below then, my apologies and the ban is fair as is. If not, then this applies.

It really sounds like you guys have a bunch of standardized measures or a checklist for this sort of thing. Which, I'm sure works as a filter most of the time. However, isn't the point of having human eyes on this, to be able to exercise reason and commonsense with regard to those things? Otherwise it'd save you time to just have it done automatically, with automatic replies sent out for tickets.

His two ticket responses didn't seek to have a discussion or explain anything, they reiterated the punishment and didn't engage him in a meaningful way. You came here to defend the idea that you don't just have bots running this thing, but what's the point if the team that we reach out to, acts exactly like an automated process? 

This guy has been up and down to Silver 1 several times, he's FINISHED THE SEASON silver 3. So he didn't even get the gold reason rewards. Why would someone who's been up to Silver 1 and down multiple times boost himself in the preseason. He's got streams with his voice/teamchat over several games and teammates who can corroborate individual games. For god's sake just match up the games you think are boosted with the games he streams and has voice chat for to determine whether your system failed at some point. If the location and mac address changes match up with the time periods in which he's moved around as well, then this seems cut and dried.

Keyru, why is it difficult for the team to come up with such an obvious solution. This is why people feel like they're interacting with robots.

A lot of people seem to be fixated on preseason because that is where the OP is saying all his proof is located.  The problem is this may have ZERO to do with preseason and could have happened at any point  during season 7.  So any talk about preseason is essentially meaningless when trying to defend the OP.  This would seem to be obvious if the OP is offering recordings of preseason specifically but not the same evidence in the regular season.

Second of all, another thing most people seem to be not understanding is that mmr boosting bans can simply be a case of 1 other person other than the OP playing a ranked game on the account in question (conceptually confirmed in a RIOT post).  So again, his rank and what ranks he fluctuates between is completely irrelevant.   No payment needs to be accepted and the 1 game can be a loss.

Third of all, and more direct to your post specifically, multiple humans have looked at this case and determined without a doubt that a violation occurred and "exercised reason and commonsense" based on DATA they hold he is guilty.  

They will never tell how or what specifically flagged it because it will put future ban waves as risk of being avoided (common sense here people)
You really believe someone would boost them to silver 3 from 1, and then un boost them from silver 3 to 1 Really hell of a boost right there. -.-

Youre so full of shit it hurts. It is impossible for you to check every single player for boosting with every other report that happens daily on league. I'm going to say you fully automate everything you can quickly look over anything in the support ticket and get lazy before claiming its not wrong. If you actually wanted to prove your point maybe you shouldnt do it aginst someone that has everything recorded.

Just an fyi for anyone reading, if any system wasnt automated in the least you would never remove anything. This is why automation on this situation isnt bad.

It is automated for the initial ban wave, but while the system is pretty accurate a mistake is possible, in which case (such as here) the player can submit a ticket and they will go over the account manually. They went out of their way here and made absolutely sure the system didn't make a mistake; which it didn't.

It is impossible for a fully manual system and it is not necessary either. This is just another case where the system worked perfectly.

Hey, you know, starting a conversation with an insult is kind of how you kill your argument. It's also the reason why a lot of the rioter's avoid making comments because instead of being treated like a human being who wants a conversation they're acted upon like some sort of insult receptacle and last time I checked only Dr. Mundo was a masochist.

Totally agree. 
But tell that to the tilted people on the boards.
Just read the replies underneath Keyru's statement...

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

Alright I would love to continue discussions, unfortunately I have not gotten a response to my latest ticket and the previous was closed because that support agent didnt want to deal with me anymore. I have never shared my account with anyone, including friends and family.

So if you'd like to reply to me, then we can further discuss. And maybe you'll actually let me present my proof that I never MMR boosted, nor shared my account with anyone. I have everything I've done on the account documented. The ticket id is 32920975

Unless you have video proof of yourself sitting at the computer for the entirety of every single ranked game you played this season, back to January, I doubt there is any conclusive proof you may have.

As others have said, Riot can fingerprint a player and determine what human is behind a game. This is quite accurate, and if they're ever in doubt, they will rescind the punishment. You've had at least three people now say the ban was justified based on independent reviews of the data.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=001b00000000,timestamp=2017-12-10T13:45:22.557+0000)
>
> Unless you have video proof of yourself sitting at the computer for the entirety of every single ranked game you played this season, back to January, I doubt there is any conclusive proof you may have.
> 
> As others have said, Riot can fingerprint a player and determine what human is behind a game. This is quite accurate, and if they're ever in doubt, they will rescind the punishment. You've had at least three people now say the ban was justified based on independent reviews of the data.

I'd like to see your proof then, good sir. Saying "we can't show you, but we've confirmed" isn't evidence. Withholding the evidence that the player was rightfully ban doesn't help anyone.
If they were to release their detection methods, it would help people evade detection.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=001b0000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-10T14:18:04.392+0000)
>
> If they were to release their detection methods, it would help people evade detection.

So are there no other ways to show any evidence other than "trust us"? Sorry, but it's pretty hard to.

> [{quoted}](name=BlakexEkalb,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=001b00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-10T15:10:20.897+0000)
>
> So are there no other ways to show any evidence other than "trust us"? Sorry, but it's pretty hard to.

Riot has no reason to lie. OP does.

If the police conduct an extensive investigation of an attempted terrorist attack, then arrest 3 people, all you will hear from them is âwe arrested # people for planning a terrorist attackâ. They do not say âwe found them by this that and the other methodâ because it has the potential to compromise other ongoing or future investigations.

A similar reasoning is in play here. You do not have to trust them, but you should - why would a company with 60 million or more players have any reason to ban a random one?

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=001b000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-10T15:44:42.732+0000)
>
> If the police conduct an extensive investigation of an attempted terrorist attack, then arrest 3 people, all you will hear from them is âwe arrested # people for planning a terrorist attackâ. They do not say âwe found them by this that and the other methodâ because it has the potential to compromise other ongoing or future investigations.
> 
> A similar reasoning is in play here. You do not have to trust them, but you should - why would a company with 60 million or more players have any reason to ban a random one?

Umm... when you are charged with a crime it is against the law for the prosecution to withold any evidence... (Source - Actual Prosecutor)

From the defendant. They can withhold the entire case from the public if they want to.

That being said, they must disclose the evidence, not how they gathered it. And there are certain exceptions to that rule even in the court system.

Since disclosing the evidence against someone in this instance would necessarily disclose how they gather it and catch people, Riot is right to not disclose it. They are not required to disclose it, either.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=001b00000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-12-11T00:18:03.124+0000)
>
> From the defendant. They can withhold the entire case from the public if they want to.
> 
> That being said, they must disclose the evidence, not how they gathered it. And there are certain exceptions to that rule even in the court system.
> 
> Since disclosing the evidence against someone in this instance would necessarily disclose how they gather it and catch people, Riot is right to not disclose it. They are not required to disclose it, either.

Yes because boosting rises to the level of a fricking terrorist investigation. Even though we dont own our accounts people still invest a lot into them. Yes they are not required to disclose but I think the policy is shit as it prevents the player from responding.
Its been an hour since you've said lets continue to discuss, and I have yet to receive a response. Saying something just so the community sides with you is in-effective unless you actually do it.

I get your frustration, but you are not assigned a player support specialist that sits with you until you're happy. They have other tickets and will get back with you as soon as they can, please be patient.

> [{quoted}](name=Keyru,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=001b,timestamp=2017-12-09T22:46:52.646+0000)
>
> Hey all,
> 
> Chiming in to say that our support team handling these types tickets are not robots and each player that is writing in regarding their MMR bans does have a human eye looking at them. I know it kind of sucks that we aren't sharing more information but this is done so that for those who are in the 100% (which we are confident in) can't retrace their steps and "fix" what they did that got them caught in the first place.
> 
> MMR Boosting doesn't have to be a paid service. It can be a simple act of sharing an account with someone and them playing ranked on it. They don't have to reach a particular tier (Gold+) and it doesn't look into how you played the majority of the season. Once someone that is not you, logs into your account and plays a ranked game, this is considered MMR Boosting. This is why we strongly tell players they should not share their account information and credentials, even to those they trust.
> 
> As to OP, I've read your case. Multiple agents and myself included, have looked into your account and we're all confident this was an accurate punishment which won't be reversed. We can continue the discussion in the support ticket that you submitted.

What if they log into your account and lose? is that ok?  MMR-de boosting lol.

It is still sharing your account, so no; not good.

I get it may be a joke reply but there is an answer if it isn't.

RIOT has just banned a wave of players that they "investigated and confirmed" to be elo boosting, and they are 100% unapologetic and unwilling to admit error, had a friend I group with damn near daily get a 14day and his season rewards revoked. RIOT is being arrogant and obnoxious, and they keep posting the same copypasta responses to players who have questions about why they were banned.

> [{quoted}](name=53W3W Drucifer,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-12-09T02:44:24.118+0000)
>
> RIOT has just banned a wave of players that they "investigated and confirmed" to be elo boosting, and they are 100% unapologetic and unwilling to admit error, had a friend I group with damn near daily get a 14day and his season rewards revoked. RIOT is being arrogant and obnoxious, and they keep posting the same copypasta responses to players who have questions about why they were banned.

Well they trust their team more than they trust some random players who, like every offender, claims they are innocent.

But I do not only claim I am, I have evidence I am, as stated in my player support message, I have all the games recorded with voice chat, I play for a team, and we review the recordings together. 

Every game, not missing a single one.

you played 900 ranked games last season.  you are claiming you used voice chat for every single one and recorded and saved them all?

LOL
Yes, either saved on Twitch or saved through LoLReplay 2.0. Idk why thats hard to believe.

Idk about the wave of bans, but I just wish they'd look into what I'm saying, they'd see I am telling the truth. I have put thousands of dollars into the game and several thousand hours. There is nothing rewarding about elo boosting in my opinion and will never do it. Besides, who elo boosts to silver 1, let alone in the preseason.
Did you share your account, did you buy your account.
I have never shared the account, and no I also didn't buy it. I've been the only person to ever play on it.

> [{quoted}](name=Red Bird Jg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-12-09T02:52:37.578+0000)
>
> I have never shared the account, and no I also didn't buy it. I've been the only person to ever play on it.

Never? Now... I dont believe that. While you have hundreds of games with flash on D, from time to time, games like these pop up where your summoner spell  changes place to F.

https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2419082291/47834247?tab=overview

Thats often sign of account being shared. Even your name was different back then
No, I just got lazy and changed the actual keybindings in game. Idk what people don't see that I HAVE PROOF. I HAVE ALL GAMES RECORDED.

> [{quoted}](name=Red Bird Jg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-09T03:02:44.785+0000)
>
> No, I just got lazy and changed the actual keybindings in game. Idk what people don't see that I HAVE PROOF. I HAVE ALL GAMES RECORDED.

Because you know that Riot wont put resources into checking thousands of games. So they would have to trust u.
So because they don't want to check if its a legit punishment, my proof is worthless ? That doesn't seem fair.

> [{quoted}](name=Red Bird Jg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-09T03:05:45.922+0000)
>
> So because they don't want to check if its a legit punishment, my proof is worthless ? That doesn't seem fair.

They have their own proofs that they got while investigating. Wasting money and time to check your recordings (which can be fabricated easily) is pointless.
Alright, lets see this, I want you to fabricate an entire game, to match the history on the RIOT api and put my voice over top of it. Let me know how easy that is.

I mean the whole keybinding part sounds fishy to me. It doesn't make sense that you changed the keybindings in-game unless you're replacing flash with another summoner spell, you won't need to change it at all. If you play with flash on D you would need to only change the summoner spell on F so why did you change flash in the first place? Also, you do realize Riot can check Ip addresses and has bots that record your play style so if it changes in a day or so it red flags it.

You do realize that IP address' can be dynamic and change everyday. Regarding the flash switch, i loaded into the game with it on the wrong key, so for that game i changed the keybindings. You know how when in lobby you click flash, and select the summoner spell you already have selected, it swaps them. Thats what I did on accident that game. You see that because its one game in 1000 that i did that.

if the games were on the old client he hit the "choose both spells" button or whatever it was, hit heal then flash, didn't realize it meant they were in the wrong order before the game started, so he fixed it by changing the keybindings in game.
That's a pretty weak sign - I've had games with flash on the wrong key after changing up roles.

> [{quoted}](name=Red Bird Jg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-12-09T02:52:37.578+0000)
>
> I have never shared the account, and no I also didn't buy it. I've been the only person to ever play on it.

Then you are most likely lying.
Like i've mentioned numerous times, I have proof I am not lying. Also why would anyone boost to silver 3, or boost to silver 1 IN THE PRESEASON....

> extensive investigation

two beep-boop robots running some spaghetti code

https://imgflip.com/s/meme/Laughing-Men-In-Suits.jpg

>I left the supporters name out for privacy reasons.

1) it's probably a bot so who cares (this is literally the exact formula for the standard response to a "wrongly banned" ticket as far as I've seen with only the name of the offense and punishments changed)
2) if by chance this is a person, I feel that we as the community should be allowed to hold this person accountable.
And that's exactly why the name was left out. You shouldn't get to hold that singular person accountable because it is more than likely just an auto reply that that person was required to do.

From the publicly available data, it does appear suspicious and definitely possible you were boosted this past season, not only at one point but possibly at multiple. If you were boosting, know that Riot has access to data that can âfingerprintâ a person - they can conclusively determine from their game data what individual is playing a match of League in over 99% of cases (but not quite 100% - there is always inconclusive or âprobably but not definitelyâ data).

If you were not boosting, Riot would have removed the suspension - there are many cases where they have done this. Every time they get a ticket they do look into the account and the data that was flagged as boosting, and they determine (a real human) whether or not an account was boosting. If Riot Support said you were boosting, then there is not much left you can do as it is virtually certain that you were.

Yes, but what would I get elo boosted for, I understand that there is always a chance I could've, but I ended the season silver 3. And now I have all the games I've played since the preseason start recorded and logged, I started a team with my friends and we've been playing together. I've almost always been on stream playing, and can be vocally heard over the communications. 

I am assuming I was flagged because my MAC address changes frequently now as I got a new job, and as a security protocol need to change it weekly, I use the Program TMAC ( Technitium Mac Address Changer ). Which I can prove. The other option is that my IP changes while I'm in a game as sometimes my internet in the house im renting goes out, so I mobile hotspot myself. (Still happens while in a game that is being streamed.)

> [{quoted}](name=Red Bird Jg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=T6weEugg,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-12-09T02:17:12.356+0000)
>
> I am assuming I was flagged because my MAC address changes frequently now as I got a new job, and as a security protocol need to change it weekly, I use the Program TMAC ( Technitium Mac Address Changer ). Which I can prove.

This is most likely the cause! In the vast majority of cases the MAC address should not change, so this is how Riot has determined that you are "being boosted." You should try to bring this up in a support ticket (hopefully reviewed by a person).

Who elo boosts between S3 and S1? That doesn't even make sense - you'd expect a boost to at least G5 so you are elgible for the next set of rewards.

>If Riot Support said you were boosting, then there is not much left you can do as it is virtually certain that you were.

This bothers me. Deeply. Riot is full of humans, humans make mistakes. We're not talking about a tox ban where the evidence is plain as day.

There is enough data collected during a game to definitively match an individual. There is furthermore enough data collected that will conclusively determine, in almost all cases, if two games were played by the same person or not.

Riot has a ton more data than we do.
